questions.title: Teens' Opinions on Technology and Health
questions.description: Between 2018 and 2019, Common Sense Media researchers surveyed over 3,000 teens and teachers from around the United States. We asked them how they felt about issues like digital well-being. What did they say? See if you can guess!

imageMetadata.resources:
2019: The New Normal: Parents, Teens, Screens, and Sleep: https://www.commonsensemedia.org/sites/default/files/uploads/research/2019-new-normal-parents-teens-screens-and-sleep-united-states-report.pdf
2018: Social Media, Social Life: https://www.commonsensemedia.org/sites/default/files/uploads/research/2018-social-media-social-life-executive-summary-web.pdf

questions.question: What percentage of teens reported "often" or "very often" trying to spend less time on their mobile device?
What percentage of teens reported waking up to check their mobile device at least once a night?
What percentage of teens reported that they think tech companies manipulate users to spend more time on their devices?

questions.title: Now it's your turn.
questions.description: In the following polls, you can share your opinions on these issues. After responding, start a conversation with some classmates or friends. Did you agree or disagree with each statement? Why, or why not?

questions.question: Turning my phone off for a while is a relief, even if I might miss out on something.
Technology and social media are tearing us apart, more than they're bringing people together.
The downsides of social media are worth it because of what we get in return.

questions.title: Want to learn more?
questions.description: Many digital citizenship issues don't have clear, right-or-wrong answers. But you can learn more by starting conversations with your classmates and friends. And for more free resources, visit us at commonsense.org/digital-citizenship.
